title: Persecution of Jews
common: On this page, we list instances of persecution against Jewish people studied in History Tracers.

value.name: The Visigoths (Sisebuto):
value.desc: During the reign of Sisebuto, Jewish people were coerced into converting to Christianity, as reported by Saint Isidore of Seville.

value.name: The Visigoth (Egica):
value.desc: The 16th Council of Toledo during the reign of Egica documented harsh treatment of Jews.

value.name: The Leme family:
value.desc: During the reign of Afonso V, Lem Maerten I authorized that his Jewish creditors be subjected to Christian justice.

value.name: The Costa Family from Beja:
value.desc: Had Jewish members who suffered persecution. Although we have not extensively researched this family, we mention them due to a mixed marriage that occurred in the 17th century. As a result of the marriage between Fernão Veira Tavares and Maria da Costa, their children were also considered Jewish, "meio-cristão-novo" [half-Jewish] according to ancient texts (Saraiva, Antonio José, , pp. 196).

value.name: Understanding Contexts (part II):
value.desc: This is the second part of a study on contexts. In it, we examine one of the darkest events in human history: the foundations that led Nazism to persecute Jews, among other peoples. We recommend that readers first read the initial text (History Tracers, , Understanding contexts (part I)).
